interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Mystery of the Shemitah Unlocked: The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future, the World's Future, and Your Future!
Review Date: 2015/06/22
Store: Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Faith & Spirituality
Product Description: ['Based on the', 'New York Times', 'Best Seller', 'The Mystery of the Shemitah', 'From the author that brought you', 'NEW YORK TIMES', 'best sellers', 'The Book of Mysteries', ',', 'The Harbinger', ', and', 'The Paradigm', 'with over 3 MILLION copies sold', 'IS IT POSSIBLE THERE EXISTS A 3,000-YEAR-OLD MYSTERY THAT…', 'Is determining America’s future, the world’s future—and your future?Has determined the rise and fall of the economy and the collapse of Wall Street?Has pinpointed the greatest stock market crashes in history down to their exact dates?Foretells the rise and fall of nations and what may be the coming fall of America?Warns of a coming calamity and how to prepare for it?\xa0 This riveting documentary DVD based on Jonathan Cahn’s', 'New York Times', 'bestsellingbook', 'The Mystery of the Shemitah', 'reveals the seven-year mystery that isessential to understand the past, the present, and the future, and holds the missingkey to end-time prophecy.\xa0 PLUS - Over fifty minutes of bonus features that go deeper into the mystery, whatlies ahead, and how you can be ready.', 'The Mystery of the Shemitah Unlocked', 'will amaze, stun, forewarn,and prepare you for what lies ahead…and it may just change your life.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Documentary/Religion', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Cahn, Jonathan', 'Runtime': '55 minutes', 'Subtitle': "The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future, the World's Future, and Your Future!The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future, the World's Future, and Your Future!   See more", 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '072270', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '55 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 31, 2015', 'Studio': 'Frontline', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I'm going to give this a 4 for those who just won't read the book. It is worth your while to get. But, if you've seen the programs, interviews, and read the books, there is not really any new information here. I bought it because I thought he was going to give some in depth advice on preparing (as the description suggests) after perhaps interviewing some professionals and alluding to what he is doing himself. But, while the spiritual preparation part was wise (and hopefully obvious)...there was little else beyond that. My only question is...how can you accurately, and with certainty, count Shemitah's if you cannot be sure when the Jubilee (50th) year is? It's not an accusation, it's just an observation. However, as history shows, there have been significant collapses during the periods noted by Cahn...so worthwhile knowledge, either way.
Review Title: If You Just Won't Read...
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Steve Oedekerk'], 'Producers': ['Steve Oedekerk', 'Mark Beam', 'Nicholisa Contis', 'Andrew Egiziano', 'Paul Marshal', 'Julia Pistor', 'Aaron Parry'], 'Starring': ['Kevin James', 'Courteney Cox', 'Sam Elliott'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']}
This movie is barely fit for adults, much less children. Adult themes dressed in children's clothing. So glad I previewed this before I let the kids watch! Trash.
Cartoons Aren't Always For Kids
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael McGowan'], 'Producers': ['Michael McGowan', 'Jody Colero', 'Avi Federgreen', 'Tamara Deverell'], 'Starring': ['James Cromwell', 'Genevieve Bujold', 'Campbell Scott'], 'Studio': ['SAMUEL GOLDWYN FILMS LLC.']}
I was torn between a four and five star rating. I considered 4 due to some unnecessary elements and length. But, I still have to give it a five. I really appreciated the portrayal of lifelong love, commitment, and the character development in this film. It seemed a bit long...but maybe that is because these filmmakers stayed true to the reality of these lives, instead of giving into the overly-dramatic, cheap, Hollywood-ism that is so prevalent in film today. Overall...well done. My husband and I truly enjoyed it.
Had To Lean To The Five
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Steven Suderman'], 'Producers': ['Steven Suderman'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']}
This is not a "How to" per se. It is more about the heart and soul, and struggles, of farming. Though we felt the film was a bit slow in some places, it is insightful and we enjoyed it very much. I particularly enjoyed watching the "animal mommy," as I've dubbed her. She is really amazing. Thank you to everyone who had a part in the making of this film. Well done.
A Beautiful Education

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** Strongly favors family-friendly media suited for children, showing disapproval of adult themes. Recently engaged with heartwarming films that explore daily life and the human-animal relationship, indicating a preference for positive, wholesome narratives.

- **Viewing Behavior:** Maintains a protective stance by pre-screening materials for children, emphasizing the importance of viewing suitable content. Appreciates character development and meaningful storytelling, demonstrating openness to slower-paced narratives that provide insights into life and relationships.

- **Rating Trends:** Displays a critical approach to media, with a tendency to withhold ratings unless deeply impressed. However, rewards high scores to educational and heartfelt stories, indicating an appreciation for content that resonates with family dynamics, even if pacing might be slower.

- **Language and Accessibility Needs:** Prefers English audio content with closed captions for clear understanding and accessibility, ensuring an inclusive viewing environment for the family.

- **Interest in Family Dynamics:** Shows ongoing concern for the suitability of entertainment for younger audiences, gravitating towards narratives underscoring realism and positive values. Interest noted in films and documentaries that provide lessons about life and community.

- **Recent Engagement with Non-Fiction:** The user has shown interest in non-fiction content exploring themes of spirituality and prophecy, suggesting a broader perspective on educational material beyond traditional family-friendly media. This indicates an openness to engaging with thought-provoking content that could enrich discussions at home.
